chapter_0_lesson_1.lesson_description: Fundamental greetings, farewells, and polite responses such as おはよう, こんにちは, こんばんは, さようなら, and ありがとうございます.

chapter_0_lesson_2.lesson_description: Common phrases used at home (いってきます, いってらっしゃい, ただいま, おかえりなさい, いただきます, ごちそうさまでした) with their romanized forms and English meanings.

chapter_0_lesson_3.lesson_description: Pragmatic and cultural notes on formality levels, context‑appropriate good‑byes, multiple senses of すみません, and the ittekimasu/itterasshai exchange.

chapter_0_lesson_4.lesson_description: Role‑play exercises for students to act out greetings and responses in everyday situations (host family introductions, classroom greetings, trains, mealtime, etc.).

chapter_0_lesson_5.lesson_description: Discussion of Japanese bowing etiquette, degrees of formality, and business‑card exchange customs.

chapter_1_lesson_1.lesson_description: Model conversations between Mary and Takeshi that introduce asking the time, self‑introductions, majors, year in school, and polite/casual responses. Includes romaji, English translations, and an illustrated scene.

chapter_1_lesson_2.lesson_description: Essential Lesson‑1 vocabulary plus extended thematic lists for Countries, Majors, Occupations, and Family terms. All items appear with kana/kanji, romaji, and English glosses.

chapter_1_lesson_3.lesson_description: Key patterns: ① XはYです statements, ② yes/no & WH‑questions with か and なん／なに, and ③ noun₁ の noun₂ possession/description. Includes particle notes (は, の), subject omission, and culture note on Japanese names.

chapter_1_lesson_4.lesson_description: Pragmatic expressions (あの, はい／ええ, そうですか), correct pronunciation/writing of the particle は, number‑reading variants, honorific titles (さん／せんせい), and guidelines for addressing others in Japanese.

chapter_1_lesson_5.lesson_description: Comprehensive drills: numbers 0‑100, telling time, reading telephone numbers, の‑phrase translations, Q&A about classmates and host family, review exercises, role‑plays, and useful expression charts for time and age.

chapter_2_lesson_1.lesson_description: Three short conversations covering asking prices at a flea market, returning a lost wallet, and ordering food in a restaurant.

chapter_2_lesson_2.lesson_title: Vocabulary: Words That Point, Food, and Everyday Items
chapter_2_lesson_2.lesson_description: Core word lists for demonstratives, locations, food, common objects, places, majors, family, money matters, and stock expressions used in stores.

chapter_2_lesson_3.lesson_description: Introduces これ／それ／あれ／どれ, この／その／あの／どの + noun, and ここ／そこ／あそこ／どこ, with usage notes and sample questions.

chapter_2_lesson_4.lesson_title: Grammar Part 2: Particle も and Negative じゃないです
chapter_2_lesson_4.lesson_description: Covers noun + も for 'also', basic negative forms (じゃないです／じゃありません／ではありません), and sentence‑ending tags ね and よ.

chapter_2_lesson_5.lesson_description: Explains （〜を）ください, （〜を）おねがいします, （〜を）どうぞ, plus sound changes in 100‑/1 000‑series numbers and how to read large numbers.

chapter_2_lesson_6.lesson_description: Overview of yen bills and coins, notable portraits, everyday use of cash vs. cards, and prepaid transit cards.

chapter_2_lesson_7.lesson_title: Practice ①–②: Numbers and Asking Prices
chapter_2_lesson_7.lesson_description: Reading numbers up to 90 000 and pair‑work questions on item prices using いくら and 円.

chapter_2_lesson_8.lesson_title: Practice ③–V: Demonstratives, Places, and Ownership
chapter_2_lesson_8.lesson_description: Activities using これ／それ／あれ, naming classroom objects, giving directions with どこ, and asking だれの about possessions.

chapter_2_lesson_9.lesson_title: Practice VI–VII: も and Negative Forms
chapter_2_lesson_9.lesson_description: Picture‑based drills for noun + も ('also') and Q‑A exercises that negate statements with じゃないです, plus nationality/major charts.

chapter_2_lesson_10.lesson_description: Customer–store‑clerk and restaurant ordering role‑plays, pricing card games, and ownership Q‑A using dialogue models.

chapter_2_lesson_11.lesson_description: Essential phrases for classroom interaction (わかりましたか, もういちど いってください, etc.) and common classroom objects.

chapter_3_lesson_1.lesson_title: Dialogues: Making a Date & Sunday Morning
chapter_3_lesson_1.lesson_description: Takeshi invites Mary to a movie and Mary chats with her host mother before a day‑trip to Kyoto.

chapter_3_lesson_2.lesson_title: Vocabulary: Leisure, Food, Time, and Core Verbs
chapter_3_lesson_2.lesson_description: Key nouns for entertainment, meals, places, and time; full verb list (u‑verbs, ru‑verbs, irregulars), adjectives, adverbs, and set expressions that appear in this chapter.

chapter_3_lesson_3.lesson_description: Forms and stems for ru‑verbs, u‑verbs, and the two irregular verbs (する, くる) in dictionary, ます, and ません shapes.

chapter_3_lesson_4.lesson_title: Grammar Part 2: Present‑Tense Meaning & Core Particles
chapter_3_lesson_4.lesson_description: Explains habitual vs. future readings of the present tense and introduces the particles を, で, に, へ for objects, locations, and goals of movement.

chapter_3_lesson_5.lesson_title: Grammar Part 3: Time Reference, Invitations, Word Order, Frequency, Topic
chapter_3_lesson_5.lesson_description: Covers when to use/omit に with time words, invitation pattern 〜ませんか, flexible sentence order, adverbs of frequency, and extended uses of the topic particle は.

chapter_3_lesson_6.lesson_title: Expression Notes 4: 行く vs. 来る & Polite Refusal『ちょっと…』
chapter_3_lesson_6.lesson_description: Cultural nuances of direction verbs and the indirect way to decline invitations using ちょっと.

chapter_3_lesson_7.lesson_title: Practice A–C: Verb Drills, Places, and Movement
chapter_3_lesson_7.lesson_description: Convert verbs to ます／ません, add objects and locations, and make sentences about going, coming, and returning.

chapter_3_lesson_8.lesson_title: Practice D–E: Pair Work & Guessing Game
chapter_3_lesson_8.lesson_description: Yes/no Q‑A drills about classmates' activities and a guessing game that reinforces verbs, destinations, and objects.

chapter_3_lesson_9.lesson_title: Practice Ⅰ: Daily Schedule & Time Questions
chapter_3_lesson_9.lesson_description: Read Mary's timetable, ask and answer 何時に… questions, and add time phrases to earlier practice sentences.

chapter_3_lesson_10.lesson_title: Practice III & IV: Invitations and Frequency Adverbs
chapter_3_lesson_10.lesson_description: Make suggestions with 〜ませんか, invite classmates to activities, and answer how‑often questions using 毎日, よく, あまり, ぜんぜん.

chapter_3_lesson_11.lesson_title: Review & Culture Note: Weekend Plans and Japanese Houses
chapter_3_lesson_11.lesson_description: Comprehensive review Q‑A, weekend‑plan role‑plays, class survey activity, and cultural reading on traditional and modern Japanese homes.

chapter_4_lesson_1.lesson_title: Dialogues: Asking Directions & The Missed Date
chapter_4_lesson_1.lesson_description: Three linked conversations—Mary finding McDonald's, recounting her solo outing, and clearing up Takeshi's mix‑up at school.

chapter_4_lesson_2.lesson_title: Vocabulary: Activities, People, Places, Time & Location Words
chapter_4_lesson_2.lesson_description: Key nouns, verbs, adverbs, and the full set of location terms (右, 前, 中, となり, etc.) used throughout the chapter.

chapter_4_lesson_3.lesson_title: Grammar Part 1: あります／います & Detailed Location Descriptions
chapter_4_lesson_3.lesson_description: Using あります／います for existence/possession/events and building X は Y の前です patterns with location vocabulary.

chapter_4_lesson_4.lesson_title: Grammar Part 2: Past Tense of です & Verbs, Particle も
chapter_4_lesson_4.lesson_description: Forms ～でした／～じゃなかったです and ～ました／～ませんでした and extending も to people, things, times, and places.

chapter_4_lesson_5.lesson_title: Grammar Part 3: Duration (～時間), Quantity (たくさん), Connector と, Expression Notes
chapter_4_lesson_5.lesson_description: Expressing how long and how many, placing quantity before/after を, using と for 'and' & 'with', plus nuances of 前／後ろ and interjections えっ／あっ.

chapter_4_lesson_6.lesson_description: Overview of official holidays, Golden Week, and movable‑Monday observances.

chapter_4_lesson_7.lesson_title: Practice Ⅰ: あります／います & Town Map Activities
chapter_4_lesson_7.lesson_description: Identify what exists in a town scene, Q‑A about one's own city, and location drills using a campus map.

chapter_4_lesson_8.lesson_title: Practice Ⅱ: Schedules, Past‑Tense Q‑A & Price Guessing
chapter_4_lesson_8.lesson_description: Read Takeshi's weekly schedule with あります, past‑tense questions about Prof. Yamashita, and a guessing game on item prices.

chapter_4_lesson_9.lesson_title: Practice Ⅲ: Past‑Tense Verbs, Mary's Week & Duration Q‑A
chapter_4_lesson_9.lesson_description: Convert verbs to ～ました／～ませんでした, narrate Mary's last week, answer what/where/when questions, and discuss hours spent on activities.

chapter_4_lesson_10.lesson_title: Pair Work: Badminton Scheduling & Map B Directions
chapter_4_lesson_10.lesson_description: Negotiate mutual free days using personal schedules and ask/answer where buildings are on an alternate city map.

chapter_4_lesson_11.lesson_title: Useful Expressions: Days, Weeks, Months, Years & Time Words
chapter_4_lesson_11.lesson_description: Comprehensive tables for weekdays, month names, dates 1‑31, and relative‑time vocabulary (先週, 来年, etc.).

chapter_5_lesson_1.lesson_description: Robert and Ken enjoy Okinawa's seaside, discuss sports plans, buy stamps, and later chat with classmates about the trip.

chapter_5_lesson_2.lesson_title: Vocabulary: Travel, Weather, Adjectives & Core Verbs
chapter_5_lesson_2.lesson_description: Nouns for travel, food, tickets, rooms; full lists of い‑ and な‑adjectives (暑い, きれい etc.), new U‑/Ru‑verbs, and key adverbs/expressions.

chapter_5_lesson_3.lesson_description: Forms for い‑adjectives, irregular いい → よ‑, な‑adjective long forms, and present/past affirmative‑negative tables.

chapter_5_lesson_4.lesson_title: Grammar Part 2: Degree Adverbs & Relational 好き／きらい
chapter_5_lesson_4.lesson_description: Using とても・すごく・ちょっと before adjectives, the X は Y が 好き／きらい construction, 大好き／大きらい, and neutral 好きでもきらいでもない.

chapter_5_lesson_5.lesson_title: Grammar Part 3: Suggestions 〜ましょう／ましょうか & Counters
chapter_5_lesson_5.lesson_description: Inviting with long‑form verbs + ましょう／ましょうか and introducing counters (～枚) with post‑noun number placement.

chapter_5_lesson_6.lesson_description: Drills converting adjectives to present affirmative/negative, describing photos, and Q‑A on room, town, and food qualities.

chapter_5_lesson_7.lesson_title: Practice II: Past Tense, Preferences & Suggestions
chapter_5_lesson_7.lesson_description: Past‑tense adjective work, Okinawa trip memo sentences, dialogue substitutions, likes/dislikes pair work, and ましょう follow‑ups.

chapter_5_lesson_8.lesson_description: Overview of Sapporo Snow, Kyoto Gion, Aomori Nebuta, Tokushima Awa Odori, and Sendai Tanabata festivals with visuals.

chapter_5_lesson_9.lesson_title: Useful Expressions: At the Post Office
chapter_5_lesson_9.lesson_description: Polite phrases for mailing items, postage questions, and vocabulary for postal services (航空便, 速達, 保険).

chapter_6_lesson_1.lesson_title: Dialogues: In Class, After Class & On the Bus
chapter_6_lesson_1.lesson_description: Robert dozes off in Japanese class, borrows Sue's notes, learns about a test, and helps an elderly lady on the bus.

chapter_6_lesson_2.lesson_title: Vocabulary: Daily Life Objects, Verbs & Tough Situations
chapter_6_lesson_2.lesson_description: Nouns for money, baths, luggage, etc.; the な‑adjective 大変; new U‑, Ru‑, and irregular verbs used in this chapter.

chapter_6_lesson_3.lesson_description: How to build the te‑form for ru‑verbs, the five u‑verb sub‑groups, and irregular verbs; includes 行く → 行って exception.

chapter_6_lesson_4.lesson_description: Using 〜てください for polite requests, 〜てもいいです／～てもいいですか for permission, and 〜てはいけません for firm prohibitions.

chapter_6_lesson_5.lesson_title: Grammar Part 3: Sequencing, Reasons (〜から) & Offers (〜ましょうか)
chapter_6_lesson_5.lesson_description: Linking actions with te‑forms, giving reasons with から, offering assistance with 〜ましょうか; includes Culture Note on Japan's school system.

chapter_6_lesson_6.lesson_title: Expression Notes 7: Late/Early, どうも Variations & Honorific お‑
chapter_6_lesson_6.lesson_description: Distinguishing 遅い vs. 遅く, casual uses of どうも, and the nuance‑adding honorific お‑ prefix.

chapter_6_lesson_7.lesson_description: Convert verbs to te‑form, sing the te‑form song, and practice classroom requests like 窓を開けてください。

chapter_6_lesson_8.lesson_description: Ask host‑family permission with 〜てもいいですか and state rules with 〜てはいけません in class and public settings.

chapter_6_lesson_9.lesson_title: Practice III: Sequencing Actions & Giving Reasons
chapter_6_lesson_9.lesson_description: Combine verbs with te‑forms to describe routines and explain plans with から; Q‑A about weekend and study habits.

chapter_6_lesson_10.lesson_title: Practice IV: Offering Help & Role‑Play Scenarios
chapter_6_lesson_10.lesson_description: Use 〜ましょうか to offer assistance, create dialogues for everyday situations, and role‑play borrowing, lending, and favors.

chapter_6_lesson_11.lesson_description: Key phrases for navigating streets—go straight, turn, cross—and cardinal directions, with a sample dialogue and map cues.

chapter_7_lesson_1.lesson_description: Sue shows her family picture to Michiko and Robert invites them to watch a funny DVD.

chapter_7_lesson_2.lesson_description: Core nouns, い‑ & な‑adjectives, verbs, and expressions used to talk about relatives, looks, and daily life.

chapter_7_lesson_3.lesson_title: Grammar Part 1: ～ている for Actions & States
chapter_7_lesson_3.lesson_description: How ～ている marks actions in progress and resultant states; includes common stative patterns like 太っています／知っています.

chapter_7_lesson_4.lesson_title: Grammar Part 2: Describing Physical Traits & Joining Adjectives
chapter_7_lesson_4.lesson_description: Use Aさんは髪が長いです; collocations 背が高い／頭がいい; te‑forms of い‑ and な‑adjectives and noun＋です for 'A is cheap **and** tasty'.

chapter_7_lesson_5.lesson_title: Grammar Part 3: Verb‑Stem＋に行く & Counting People
chapter_7_lesson_5.lesson_description: Express purpose of motion (映画を見に行く) and count people with ひとり／ふたり／〜にん; includes place‑には X 人います structure.

chapter_7_lesson_6.lesson_title: Expression Notes 8: 遊ぶ Uses & 知る vs. わかる
chapter_7_lesson_6.lesson_description: Nuances of 遊ぶ ('hang out'), correct verbs for 'play' in sports/games, and polite vs. rude ways to say 'I don't know'.

chapter_7_lesson_7.lesson_title: Practice I: ～ている Actions & Family Facts
chapter_7_lesson_7.lesson_description: Identify ongoing actions in pictures and interview classmates about what they were doing at specific times; Q‑A about Sue's family.

chapter_7_lesson_8.lesson_description: Use physical‑attribute patterns to describe illustrated characters and classmates; guess who is who from clues.

chapter_7_lesson_9.lesson_title: Practice III: Combining Adjectives & Childhood Memories
chapter_7_lesson_9.lesson_description: Make sentences with adjective‑te links (静かで大きい) and reflect on childhood home, school, friends, etc.

chapter_7_lesson_10.lesson_description: Create 行きます／来ます sentences with Verb‑Stem＋に; role‑play why characters go to various places.

chapter_7_lesson_11.lesson_title: Practice V: Counting People & Summary Q‑A
chapter_7_lesson_11.lesson_description: Ask how many people with 〜人 in the room and answer review questions about residence, jobs, and possessions.

chapter_7_lesson_12.lesson_description: How family members are referred to in other families, formal self‑reference, casual speech, and direct address.

chapter_7_lesson_13.lesson_title: Useful Expressions: Parts of the Body
chapter_7_lesson_13.lesson_description: Vocabulary for body parts with labeled illustrations—essential for describing appearance or ailments.

chapter_8_lesson_1.lesson_description: Michiko invites friends to a barbecue; at the party Robert cooks and everyone waits for Mary to arrive before toasting.

chapter_8_lesson_2.lesson_description: Key nouns, な‑adjectives, verbs, and expressions about food, weather forecast, jobs, and leisure activities.

chapter_8_lesson_3.lesson_description: Form all present‑tense affirmative & negative short forms for verbs, adjectives, and noun＋です; irregular patterns included.

chapter_8_lesson_4.lesson_description: When and how to drop です／ます, form casual questions without か, and omit だ at sentence end with な‑adjectives & nouns.

chapter_8_lesson_5.lesson_description: Use short forms＋と思います / と言っていました for thoughts and indirect quotations; preserve original tense.

chapter_8_lesson_6.lesson_description: Make requests with ～ないでください and express likes, dislikes, skills with verb‑phrase＋のが好き／上手／下手.

chapter_8_lesson_7.lesson_title: Grammar Part 5: Subject Marker が & 何か／何も
chapter_8_lesson_7.lesson_description: Focus and 'blank‑filling' が; question‑word subjects; use 何か (something) and 何も＋negative (not … anything).

chapter_8_lesson_8.lesson_title: Expression Notes 9: する‑Verbs & Their Nouns
chapter_8_lesson_8.lesson_description: How nouns like 勉強/料理 pair with する, appear as objects, and work with 好き／きらい constructions.

chapter_8_lesson_9.lesson_description: Convert verbs & adjectives to negative short forms; answer everyday questions in informal speech.

chapter_8_lesson_10.lesson_title: Practice II: Guessing with ～と思います
chapter_8_lesson_10.lesson_description: Make and answer guesses about people and places; describe pictures and discuss opinions in groups.

chapter_8_lesson_11.lesson_description: Report classmates' statements using ～と言っていました and gather classmates' weekend schedules.

chapter_8_lesson_12.lesson_title: Practice IV: Negative Requests & Skill Preferences
chapter_8_lesson_12.lesson_description: Form 'please don't …' sentences and talk about likes/dislikes or abilities with のが好き／上手／下手.

chapter_8_lesson_13.lesson_description: Ask and answer questions like だれがXですか using a data table about Robert, Mary, Sue and Takeshi.

chapter_8_lesson_14.lesson_title: Practice VI: 何も・Party Actions & Weekend Plans
chapter_8_lesson_14.lesson_description: Say you 'did nothing' with 何も＋negative; interview classmates about meals, shopping and TV.

chapter_8_lesson_15.lesson_description: Plan a party, gather 'find‑someone‑who' data, and negotiate a four‑person day trip using reported speech.

chapter_8_lesson_16.lesson_title: Culture Note: Japanese Foods & Modern Meals
chapter_8_lesson_16.lesson_description: Overview of common Japanese dishes, set meals (定食), and breakfast comparisons between Michiko and Prof. Yamashita.

chapter_9_lesson_1.lesson_description: Takeshi invites Mary to Kabuki, they chat during intermission, and buy bento and drinks at the stand.

chapter_9_lesson_2.lesson_description: Nouns, adjectives, verbs and counters covering Kabuki, weather, music, sickness, colors and small‑item numbers.

chapter_9_lesson_3.lesson_description: Form past affirmative & negative short forms for all verbs, adjectives and noun＋です; irregular patterns (行く, いい).

chapter_9_lesson_4.lesson_title: Grammar Part 2: Relative Clauses with Verbs & Adjectives
chapter_9_lesson_4.lesson_description: Use short‑form clauses (踊っている人 etc.) to qualify nouns; review examples with adjectives and relational 好きな.

chapter_9_lesson_5.lesson_title: Grammar Part 3: 'Not Yet' – まだ～ていません
chapter_9_lesson_5.lesson_description: Contrast past tense vs. まだ～ていません for unfinished actions; apply to change‑ and activity‑type verbs.

chapter_9_lesson_6.lesson_description: Embed reasons before situations with から, showing both polite & short‑form styles and common request patterns.

chapter_9_lesson_7.lesson_title: Practice I: Short‑Form Past Conjugation & Informal Q&A
chapter_9_lesson_7.lesson_description: Drills converting verbs/adjectives to past short forms; ask & answer daily‑life questions in casual speech.

chapter_9_lesson_8.lesson_title: Practice II: Childhood & Guessing with ～と思います
chapter_9_lesson_8.lesson_description: Discuss childhood traits, make guesses about Mary & Yamashita‑sensei, and describe classmates' pasts.

chapter_9_lesson_9.lesson_title: Practice III: Reported Speech ～と言っていました
chapter_9_lesson_9.lesson_description: Report statements about music tastes, Kabuki, illness, and interview classmates then relay their answers.

chapter_9_lesson_10.lesson_title: Practice IV: Identifying People with ～ている
chapter_9_lesson_10.lesson_description: Use clauses like めがねをかけている人 to pick out people in pictures and describe classmates' mimed actions.

chapter_9_lesson_11.lesson_title: Practice V: まだ～ていません Dialogues & Invitations
chapter_9_lesson_11.lesson_description: Answer 'Have you… yet?' with まだ～ていません; invite friends if not, or ask for opinions if already done.

chapter_9_lesson_12.lesson_title: Practice VI: Reason Clauses – Matching & Completion
chapter_9_lesson_12.lesson_description: Match sentences halves and add personal reasons using から to explain lack of money, study motives, etc.

chapter_9_lesson_13.lesson_title: Summary Tasks: Fast‑Food Ordering & Q‑A Marathon
chapter_9_lesson_13.lesson_description: Role‑play ordering from a menu, answer 13 personal questions, and picture‑pairwork with classroom scene.

chapter_9_lesson_14.lesson_title: Culture Note: Japanese Traditional Performing & Martial Arts
chapter_9_lesson_14.lesson_description: Brief introductions to Kabuki, Bunraku, Rakugo, Noh, Sumo, Judo, Kendo, Tea ceremony and Ikebana.

chapter_9_lesson_15.lesson_description: List of color adjectives/nouns, how to use them as modifiers, and idiomatic examples like 顔が青い.

chapter_10_lesson_1.lesson_description: Mary and Takeshi compare Korea vs. Taiwan, discuss money & souvenirs; Mary reserves an Osaka → Seoul flight.

chapter_10_lesson_2.lesson_title: Vocabulary: Seasons, Travel, Money & Everyday Life
chapter_10_lesson_2.lesson_description: Nouns, adjectives, verbs and counters covering seasons, clothes, transport, sports, colors, medicine, flights, etc.

chapter_10_lesson_3.lesson_title: Grammar Part 1: Comparisons Between Two Items
chapter_10_lesson_3.lesson_description: Use AのほうがBより and questions with どちら／どっち to say which is bigger, faster, cheaper, etc.

chapter_10_lesson_4.lesson_description: Say what's best with いちばん, choose items with adjectives/nouns + の to avoid repetition.

chapter_10_lesson_5.lesson_description: Present‑short verb + つもり to express plans or non‑plans for the future.

chapter_10_lesson_6.lesson_description: Form changes with 暖かくなる, 静かになる, 会社員になる; relative vs. absolute change.

chapter_10_lesson_7.lesson_title: Grammar Part 5: Indefinites—どこか・どこにも・だれか・何も
chapter_10_lesson_7.lesson_description: Say 'somewhere', 'nowhere', 'someone', etc., and see how they merge with particles like に／へ.

chapter_10_lesson_8.lesson_title: Grammar Part 6: で for Means & Tools + Sentence‑final が／けど
chapter_10_lesson_8.lesson_description: Use で with transport & instruments (バスで, はしで) and polite sentence‑final が to yield the floor.

chapter_10_lesson_9.lesson_description: Charts & Q‑A on trains vs. buses, islands' sizes, people's height/age to master Aより constructions.

chapter_10_lesson_10.lesson_description: Ask classmates 'Which is best?' and produce superlative statements about food, people, seasons, etc.

chapter_10_lesson_11.lesson_title: Practice III: Pronoun の & Choosing Items
chapter_10_lesson_11.lesson_description: Dorm‑fridge ownership drill and pair Q‑A picking gloves, pants, guidebooks using 赤いの／安いの, etc.

chapter_10_lesson_12.lesson_title: Practice IV: Future Plans with ～つもり
chapter_10_lesson_12.lesson_description: State what you will/won't do next week, interview partners about study, trips, TV, and exams.

chapter_10_lesson_13.lesson_description: Describe picture changes (きれい→きれいになりました) and fill‑in‑blanks using 暑く／静かに etc.

chapter_10_lesson_14.lesson_title: Practice VI: Something / Nothing / Somewhere Drills
chapter_10_lesson_14.lesson_description: Answer charts about Mary & Takeshi (何か食べましたか), then interview classmates with 何も／どこか.

chapter_10_lesson_15.lesson_title: Practice VII: Transportation で & Time Needed
chapter_10_lesson_15.lesson_description: Use で and どのぐらい to say 'I bike to the station in 10 min'; survey classmates' commutes.

chapter_10_lesson_16.lesson_title: Summary Tasks: Winter‑Vacation Plans & Ticket Reservations
chapter_10_lesson_16.lesson_description: Q‑A on Mary's Korea trip, pair interviews, fast travel‑agency role‑plays with flights & seat types.

chapter_10_lesson_17.lesson_title: Culture Note: Public Transportation & Money‑Saving Passes
chapter_10_lesson_17.lesson_description: Explains JR Pass, Seishun 18 kippu, highway buses, with Shinkansen & bus photos.

chapter_10_lesson_18.lesson_title: Useful Expressions: At the Station & Train Announcements
chapter_10_lesson_18.lesson_description: Vocabulary for train types, tickets, seats, station areas, PA phrases and sample Q‑A.
